Understate: The claim may understate the current vaccine manufacturing capability of South Africa as it mentions that the country has not manufactured vaccines start to finish since the early 2000s.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or data to back up the assertion that South Africa has an established vaccine manufacturing capability.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that having expertise in vaccine development and conducting clinical trials automatically translates to having an established vaccine manufacturing capability.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that South Africa may have the capability to develop and trial vaccines, but not necessarily manufacture them from start to finish.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that South Africa currently does not manufacture human vaccines, as confirmed by the CEO of Biovac Institute.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing a clear and consistent picture of South Africa's current vaccine manufacturing capability.
